commitResults.messageTitle: chore: update build.gradle to point to correct main class
commitResults.messageBody: Changed build.gradle default main class to Duke. Now builds successfully with command ./gradlew run.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: add checkstyle and shadow to build.gradle along with junit dependency
commitResults.messageBody:
Added recommended CheckStyle and Shadow plugins, and added ShadowJar configurations as well. Included the recommended JUnit dependencies and created test folder in src to go along with it.

Still missing tests. Will be writing the tests later.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build level-1 features - greet, echo, exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed the name to Duchess and separated the functions into introduction, echo and goodbye functions of the Duchess class. The main function now initialises a Duchess object before using it to execute actions.

To do: perhaps abstract the whole running process into a function of Duchess as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: shift logic in main function to the run instance method for duchess
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes more sense for the duchess to handle the logic of taking in inputs and processing them accordingly.

Next step may be to separate the main function into a public class of its own.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: shift public main function to a public Main class
commitResults.messageBody:
Makes more sense for a Main class to handle the initialisation of a Duchess instance and making it run.

Meets Level-1 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build level-2 features - add, list
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently using an ArrayList<String> to contain the added messages. Extended on existing methods and created new methods to handle the new cases. Also abstracted the input reading to a separate function. Plus added more personality to the 'chatbot'

Issue: need to fix default syntax with the switch case to follow the guidelines proposed. Need to look into creating a special print method as well to make the replies more recognizable.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: add indentation to duchess responses
commitResults.messageBody:
Added tabbing in front of all replies to make the replies more visible and distinguishable from user input.

To fix: code style

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: fix up code style especially for switch case
commitResults.messageBody: Fixed indentation and code style issues based on CS2103 guidelines, namely the switch case default indentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add task class
commitResults.messageBody:
Added a class Task to manage task description and completion status, and encapsulate related methods and fields.

To do: incorporate Tasks into the original Duchess class.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change task access modifiers and change printTask to return string
commitResults.messageBody:
Made Task methods public and changed printTask() to getTaskInformation() instead, which returns a String instead of printing.

To do: incorporate into Duchess

commitResults.messageTitle: feat+refactor: incorporate Task class into Duchess
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified existing methods to use Task instead of the original String. Slight modificiation to access modifiers and field naming conventions as well.

To do: Add ability to process the done command from users.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: change cross for incomplete to the correct unicode character
commitResults.messageBody: The unicode was previously ❌, now it's ✘ as required.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add done functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Added functionality to Duchess to allow completion of tasks. Meets Level-3 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: change implementation of methods of task
commitResults.messageBody:
After consulting the Partial Solutions on the website, realised that the implementation of some of my existing methods can be improved. Changed getTaskInformation to toString, which makes more sense. Abstracted out the status icon generation into a separate method as well. However, kept toggleIsCompleted the same to allow for future extension, e.g. need to set Task as undone.

To do: create three more classes that extends from Task as per Level-4 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add deadline class
commitResults.messageBody: Created Deadline class to extend from Task. Allows for the addition of a deadline. Overrides Task's toString() to include the Deadline type and deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add event class
commitResults.messageBody: Created Event class to extend from Task. Allows for the addition of a duration. Overrides Task's toString() to include the Event type and duration.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add todo class
commitResults.messageBody:
Created ToDo class to extend from Task. Overrides Task's toString() to include the ToDo type.

To do: incorporate the three children classes into Duchess' implementation.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add todos, events and deadlines for duchess
commitResults.messageBody:
Added support for ToDo, Event and Deadline creation. Also added handling of unrecognized inputs with the echo() function. Achieves Level-4 requirements.

To do: just realised that I am recursively calling the awaitInput() function. May be wiser to refactor the awaitInput() function to do this process iteratively instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: add text-ui-test
commitResults.messageBody:
Added text-ui-test to the project. The test tests the creation of all three types of tasks, as well as completion, listing, and unrecognized command handling.

To do: fix up Duchess introduce() method such that an error is not thrown due to the difference in blank spaces.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: remove trailing white spaces in duchess introduce() method
commitResults.messageBody: Fix issue where trailing white spaces were causing differences in the diff between ACTUAL.txt and EXPECTED.txt. Did not want to use diff -b, hence fixed up the introduce() method instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add custom exception DuchessException
commitResults.messageBody:
Added DuchessException class to help handle exceptions that occur. Simply by passing in the error message, the message is formatted accordingly.

To do: to modify Duchess to use DuchessException.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat+refactor: refactor duchess awaitInput and incorporate DuchessException
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed implementation of awaitInput() to be iterative instead of recursive. Added use of DuchessExceptions to handle the following cases:

No deadline /by or event /at.

No description for any task.

Completion of task that does not exist/out of range

Unrecognized input was already handled, no change to that implementation. This meets Level 5 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: change arrays to ArrayList in Duchess
commitResults.messageBody: Was originally only using ArrayList for the task list. Changed arrays used in intermediate steps to ArrayList as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: change access modifiers to increase security
commitResults.messageBody: Changed a few access modifiers to be more restrictive.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add delete functionality
commitResults.messageBody:
Added ability to delete task based on index as per Level 6 requirements.

To do: clean up the code in Duchess.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add CommandType enum to better handle user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Use CommandType enum to handle user inputs. This includes the handling of unrecognized user input - it will no longer fall to the default case, and an exception is thrown immediately.

To do: clean up methods and abstract some logic away. Currently too much logic is packed into Duchess class.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: change runtest.sh to find all java files even in subdirectories
commitResults.messageBody: Prior implementation of runtest.sh will only compile files in the first level directory. Changed it to use find to first find all java files then compile them accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: add handling of empty list
commitResults.messageBody: Now added a custom response when the user asks for list but the list of tasks is currently empty.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: add gson dependency to build.gradle
commitResults.messageBody: Looking into using GSON for saving tasks into JSON format. Experimental stage at the moment.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add overloaded constructors for task and subclasses of task
commitResults.messageBody:
To enable to construction of completed Tasks directly from saved data, the constructors for Task and its subclasses Event, ToDo, Deadline have been overloaded.

To do: build Storage to help save and load data.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add Storage.java
commitResults.messageBody:
Storage.java helps to save the tasks into JSON upon every change, and helps to load the tasks from the JSON file as well upon start up of the program.

To do: Use Storage in Duchess implementation.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: use Storage in Duchess
commitResults.messageBody: Modified Duchess to use Storage upon launch and upon every change to the list of tasks. Meets Level-7 requirements as of now.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: stop task from being uncompleted through the done command
commitResults.messageBody:
Added an additional check to ensure that the task is uncompleted before allowing user to complete it via the done command.

Future extension: allow user to say undone or some equivalent command to mark a task as incomplete.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: change deadline implementation to use localdatetime
commitResults.messageBody:
Change Deadline to accept LocalDateTime instead of String for deadline. Changed the appropriate toString() method as well.

To do: change Duchess to utilise new implementation of Deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: use localdatetime in duchess
commitResults.messageBody:
Changed implementation for Deadline creation to use LocalDateTime instead of String. Two different formatters were designed, to allow for both Date and DateTime entry.

To do: extend on current toString() of Deadline to make the deadline more meaningful.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build datetimestringformatter to provide meaningful dates
commitResults.messageBody:
Built a helper class DateTimeStringFormatter with static method formatDateTime that returns a meaningful string from a given LocalDateTime. The standards would be as follows:

If the deadline is overdue, it'll say [OVERDUE].

If the deadline is today, it will say today.

If the deadline is yesterday, it will say yesterday.

If the deadline is tomorrow, it will say tomorrow.

If the deadline is within 1 week, it will say the day of the week e.g. Mon Tues.

If the deadline is within the same year, the year is omitted.

Else it will return the full date and time.

To do: Need to touch up the Duchess class.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add better input handling for deadlines
commitResults.messageBody:
Allows creation of Deadline via timings such as today, tonight, tomorrow, day of the week, and two different formats of datetimes.

Meets the Level-8 requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build tasklist
commitResults.messageBody:
Create TaskList class to help manage Tasks. Currently has a basic implementation that allows for addition, deletion, getting, etc.

To do: Printing, Completing tasks etc.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor+feat: rebuild command enums
commitResults.messageBody: Abstracted the execute function to behind the enums for the Command. Renamed from CommandType to Command as well. This enables polymorphism in Duchess subsequently.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build commandhandler
commitResults.messageBody:
CommandHandler is a class built just to provide the static functions for Command Enums to operate with. The functions all take in 4 parameters - command, ui, storage, tasklist, and returns Void.

To do: implement QuadFunction

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build quadfunction interface
commitResults.messageBody: Built functional interface QuadFunction. This allows the creation of functions that operate with 4 parameters.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: improve datetimestringformatter
commitResults.messageBody: Change the implementation of the DateTimeStringFormatter slightly to not produce [OVERDUE] when the task is completed.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: improve taskList
commitResults.messageBody: Improvements to TaskList has been done to allow for better management of tasks in the list.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: remove unnecessary construtor
refactor: shift filePath entry point to be in Main
refactor: use tasklist implementation in storage
commitResults.messageBody: Changed the implementation of saving and loading to that of TaskList. Improved the error handling of Storage as well, and it now throws DuchessExceptions.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build a datetimeparser
commitResults.messageBody: This DateTimeParser helps to recognize the deadline given in string form. Uses Optionals instead of error handling to achieve the intended outcome.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build parser
commitResults.messageBody: Built a Parser class with only one static method of parsing line from Ui.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build ui
commitResults.messageBody: Built a Ui class that helps to take in input and print out output.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: huge refactor to duchess
commitResults.messageBody: This refactor sees Duchess being stripped of its original methods, leaving only its constructors and run(). Everything else has been abstracted to the appropriate classes. Meets A-MoreOOP requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: pack classes into packages
commitResults.messageBody: Packed all java files into their respective packages, namely command, exception, io, storage, task, ui, utils. Meets A-Packages requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change utils folder to util instead
docs: add javadoc for command enum
docs: add javadoc for commandhandler class

docs: add javadoc for datetimestringformatter class
docs: add javadoc for quadfunction interface
docs: add javadoc for main class
feat: add help command
commitResults.messageBody: Added a help command to allow users to see available commands as well as the acceptable DateTime formats.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add helper class pair
commitResults.messageBody: The Pair class helps to keep two different pieces of data together. This is to support the find operation.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build find command
commitResults.messageBody: Added support for the find command.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update javadoc for commandhandler class
docs: update javadoc for task class
docs: update javadoc for tasklist class
docs: update javadoc for ui class
docs: add javadoc for pair class
feat: update ui help message
commitResults.messageBody: Update the help message to include the find command.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: improve error handling of storage
commitResults.messageBody: Storage used to fail completely once the data folder is not found. Now, upon failure to locate the JSON save file, Storage will check if the data folder exists. If it does not exist, it'll create one and start from a new save file. Else, it will simply start from a new save file.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: add exception handling for tasklist removetask and gettask
commitResults.messageBody:
Added an additional check for the index in the getTask and removeTask operations. Although this is not supposed to happen in the Duchess program due to prior checks, this is for future extensions which may utilise the TaskList class.

This change causes Ui and CommandHandler to break. Exception handling will need to be added to their methods as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: add exception handling to printtasklist
commitResults.messageBody:
As TaskList added exception handling for its getTask functions, printTaskList had to be modified to throw the DuchessException upwards.

To fix: CommandHandler

commitResults.messageTitle: fix+perf: unpack imports and add exception handling to handlelistcommand
commitResults.messageBody: Slight change in IDE settings allowed for the import statements to be fully unpacked. The handleListCommand now throws DuchessException, which is from the ui.printTaskList function.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: unpack imports for storage
commitResults.messageBody: Change in IDE settings allows for fully unpacked import statements. Changed Storage's initial import duchess.task.* to the individual import statements.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for deadline
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for the Deadline class tests its inheritance from the Task class and its overriden toString() method.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for event
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for the Event class tests its inheritance from the Task class and its overridden toString() method.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for todo
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for the Event class tests its inheritance from the ToDo class and its overridden toString() method.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for task
commitResults.messageBody:
The JUnit test for Task checks its overloaded constructors and the following methods:
- isCompleted
- toggleIsCompleted
- toString

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for tasklist
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for TaskList checks its overloaded constructors, addTask, getTask (success and exception), removeTask (success and exception), completeTask (success and exception), getTaskArray and find methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: improve storage to enable nested directory saving
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous implementation allowed a JSON file saved in a directory - no other possibilities e.g. no directory, nested directories. New implementation now caters for all of these possibilities, and will generate the folders required to save it.

Added this. in front of gson instances.

To do: Write tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add additional getters for deadline and event
commitResults.messageBody: Added additional getters to facilitate JUnit testing. This includes getting the deadline of the Deadline instance, and the timeFrame of the Event instance.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: remove unnecessary try catch in tasklisttest
commitResults.messageBody: Previous implementation utilised a try-catch-fail approach to test for success scenarios. New implementation now simply throws the exception upwards, which will terminate the JUnit testing more meaningfully as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for duchessexception
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for DuchessException checks for the successful initialisation of the DuchessException instance, namely the errorMessage.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for parser
commitResults.messageBody: The JUnit test for Parser checks for the ability of the static method parse to correctly parse commands of each command type, as well as the ability to correctly handle unrecognised commands.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: write junit test for storage
commitResults.messageBody:
The JUnit test for Storage is slightly more complicated than the rest. It looks out for the following:
- Trying to load a save file from a folder that does not exist
- Trying to load a save file that does not exist
- Successfully loading a save file
- Trying to load a save file in a nested directory when no folders exist
- Saving to an invalid file path
- Saving to a valid file path

The cleanUp() method is run after all tests and helps to delete all folders and files created in the process of testing.

Currently lacking the ability to test the exception handling of Storage when a file path so incorrect is passed in that it causes Storage to be unable to generate the required folders. The exception that states that saving will be not possible should be thrown up.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: change quadfunction implementation
commitResults.messageBody:
Removed the need for a return type for QuadFunction due to the default void return type. This in turn removed the need for CommandHandler to specifically return null in order to fit the original Void return type.

The types in Command and CommandHandler were thus changed accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(DateTimeStringFormatter): fix typo in javadoc
commitResults.messageBody: Changed @Code to @code.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs(Ui): fixed javadoc
commitResults.messageBody: Added the changes in exceptions and parameters.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs(TaskList): updated javadoc
commitResults.messageBody: Updated JavaDoc to the newest implementations.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: add javadoc for todotest class
docs: add javadoc for tasktest class
docs: add javadoc for tasklisttest class
docs: add javadoc for deadlinetest class
docs: add javadoc for parsertest class
docs: add javadoc for storagetest class
docs: add javadoc for duchessexceptiontest class
docs: add javadoc for eventtest class
style: fix javadoc style with
commitResults.messageBody:
Corrected

to be at the start of the second paragraph, instead of between the two paragraphs. This seems to differ from the official JavaDocs style.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: add comment behind unicode characters
commitResults.messageBody: Added trailing comments behind statements with /uXXXX characters, which use an escape character to express a unicode character. This is in line with the CheckStyle requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: indent line continuations in javadoc
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, there were line continuations in JavaDoc that were completely left aligned.

Now, the line continuations are fixed to be tabbed to the same extent as the line that it is continuing.

Fixed according to CheckStyle requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: plus symbol to be on next line
commitResults.messageBody: Small fix: + symbol was accidentally left on the top line right before the line break. Shifted down to be on the bottom line, according to CheckStyle requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: fix storagetest according to checkstyle requirements
commitResults.messageBody:
The below were fixed:
- Declaration of variables too far away from usage of variables.
- Indentation issue with arrays - the indentation required differed from the usual 8 spaces. Used ArrayList to sidestep the issue.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: add checkstyle version requirement
commitResults.messageBody:
Left out the CheckStyle tool version previously when implementing A-Gradle. Fixed.

Will be shifting the A-Gradle tag up to the merge of this branch subsequently.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: remove main class and change duchess to duke
commitResults.messageBody: According to requirements mentioned during lecture, the Main class has been removed and the starting point of the program is now the Duke class. gradle.build has been updated accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: fix up text-ui-test to work with new changes
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous text-ui-test was designed to work with the old Duchess. It would not work for the current Duchess.

Updated to clear data from previous tests, compile and run.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update duke javadoc
commitResults.messageBody: Fixed some mistakes.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add launcher to project
commitResults.messageBody: Added Launcher.java to project, and changed build.gradle to start from Launcher.java.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: extend duke from javafx application
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the project used to run from Duke.

Changes were made to Duke such that it extends from JavaFX Application, and now has the start() method. Implemented Tutorials 1 and 2 of the JavaFX tutorials, but changed the implementation of the window to follow the flexbox concept - using VBox and HBox to allow for responsiveness.

To do: Continue with tutorial to implement everything else.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add custom dialog box with user images
commitResults.messageBody:
Created a custom control named DialogBox that helps with the display of dialogs.

Incorporated that into Duke.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: rename controls folder to controller
commitResults.messageBody: Changed the name of the controls folder to controller.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add main class
commitResults.messageBody: Added a Main class to link UI and Duke. As per JavaFX Tutorial 4 instructions.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add dialogbox and mainwindow fxml
commitResults.messageBody: Added the two fxml according to JavaFX Tutorial 4.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add mainwindow controller
commitResults.messageBody: Added the controller for MainWindow. Changed MainWindow from that in tutorial to use fx:root construct.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: remove javafx code from duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Removed JavaFX related code from Duke class.

A lot of code still commented out, will clean up subsequently.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: update javafx version
commitResults.messageBody: Updated JavaFX version from 11 to 11.0.1.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: update shadowjar version to 0.1.4
commitResults.messageBody: Updated the ShadowJar Archive Version to 0.1.4.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: update mainwindow fxml and controller
commitResults.messageBody:
Change implementation of MainWindow to use VBox instead of AnchorPane.

Change the initialisation of MainWindow to get initial output of Duke and display it out.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: change dialogbox implementation
commitResults.messageBody: Changed the DialogBox implementation to use HBox and updated all profile images to be circular.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: reformat fxml files
commitResults.messageBody: Now following code requirements for line length.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: change quadfunction and commandhandler to return string
commitResults.messageBody: Due to the need to return a string to the MainWindow, the implementation of QuadFunction and CommandHandler has been changed to return a String instead of printing straight to System.out.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat+docs: change mainwindow to vbox and set min dimensions and add javadoc
feat+docs: add handling of both gui and console mode and add javadoc
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified Launcher to be able to allow for console mode. This is done via the -mode console flag.

Added JavaDoc as well for the new class and methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: convert mode to lowercase
commitResults.messageBody: Previously, the flag `-mode console` required the word `console` to be lowercase. Now it converts the input string to lowercase before checking, thus all cases are now allowed.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: change duchessexception to extend from runtimeexception
commitResults.messageBody: Previously, a DuchessException thrown during Stream operations could not be thrown upwards. This is fixed by extending DuchessException from RuntimeException instead.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: convert ui to return strings instead
commitResults.messageBody: Change majority of Ui methods to return Strings instead of printing to console. Additional methods that print to console were added to support console mode.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat(duke): add ability to support both console and gui mode
commitResults.messageBody:
Modified Duke to be able to run on both console and GUI mode. This is done via overloading the constructor and dedicating the run() method for console mode, and the getResponse() method for GUI mode.

This meets the A-JavaFX requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor(storage): change implementation of directory creation
commitResults.messageBody: Changed an iterative approach to using the inbuilt File.mkdirs()

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: add error handling to task creation in commandhandler
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, if you entered "todo"/"event"/"deadline" as a single word, an exception will be thrown and uncaught, causing the application to terminate.

Added additional checks to ensure that a DuchessException is thrown in this situation.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: touchup ui results
commitResults.messageBody: Cleaned up on leftover differences in Ui formatting due to the switch from CLI to GUI.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add magicstrings class
commitResults.messageBody:
The MagicStrings class will contain all of the strings scattered around the Duchess application, keeping it centralised and reusable.

This excludes the strings used in Ui, which is localised as it is.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: clean up datetimestringformatter
commitResults.messageBody: Removed the usage of magic strings and cleaned up the use of DateTimeFormatters, making the code easier to read and understand.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: remove all magic strings
commitResults.messageBody: Removed all instances of magic strings and centralised them in the MagicStrings class.

commitResults.messageTitle: perf: change visibility of task fields and abstracted out symbol
commitResults.messageBody:
Updated the visibility of the fields of Task to be protected instead of private.

Pulled out the symbols such as [T] and [D] to be a static variable in their respective classes as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: change package name to duke
commitResults.messageBody:
Major refactoring to prevent any future issues with grading. The package name has been renamed from duchess to duke, and all import and package statements have been updated accordingly.

Fixed some minor JavaDoc issues as well.

To do: Week 5 increments.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: change build.gradle to point to new package
commitResults.messageBody: Previously left build.gradle's mainClassName as duchess.Launcher. Changed it to be duke.Launcher.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: fix some line length issues
commitResults.messageBody:
In the process of changing duchess to duke, some files had their lines reformatted, leading to very long lines of code. Though not violating the maximum length, it still led to code that is uncomfortable to read.

The lines have all been reformatted accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add assertions to commandhandler
commitResults.messageBody: Added assertions to command handler. They function as pre-condition assertions, checking if the command that called them is the one that called them. This is a pre-condition since the command that could call them would naturally be the correct command.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: clean up on code
commitResults.messageBody: Slight touch up on code

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: attempt to fix travis test error
commitResults.messageBody:
Previous commit threw an error in DeadlineTest.java's toString() method. Trying to isolate it now.

Highly likely to be related to the LocalDateTime class.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: specify jdk version and fix dialogbox
test: experiment with deadlinetest
commitResults.messageBody: Still facing issues with DeadlineTest toString() test.

commitResults.messageTitle: test: fix deadlinetest issues
commitResults.messageBody: Attempt #5 to fix issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: remove deadlinetest toString() test
commitResults.messageBody: Cannot figure out how to fix. Currently implemented a workaround.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: improve natural dates parsing
refactor: break commandhandler into separate classes
commitResults.messageBody: Separated CommandHandler into three different classes with their own private helper methods. The three classes are AdminCommandHandler, TaskCreationHandler and TaskListCommandHandler. Within each of the handlers, repeated code were abstracted out into private helper methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: abstract and clean up code in storage
commitResults.messageBody: Pulled out a lot of code from various functions to follow the SLAP principle.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: update ui methods in duke
commitResults.messageBody: Updated Ui methods in Duke, as Ui methods were changed during Level-10 increment.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: improve readability of datetimestringformatter
commitResults.messageBody: Made the formatDateTime method a lot more readable.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: fix error in boolean return value of storage method
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, isAbleToSave() returned false even when able to due to an additional ! in front of one of the conditions.

Bugs have been fixed and tests should pass now.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add dark mode and update general style
commitResults.messageBody: Delved into JavaFX and added dark mode functionality to the app. Still quite new to JavaFX, hence made minimal changes overall.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: remove commandhandler
commitResults.messageBody: May have been due to merge issues - CommandHandler.java somehow was leftover in src. Removed.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add closing of window for bye command
feat: build the recurring deadline class
commitResults.messageBody: Added a RecurringDeadline class that extends from Deadline.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add recurring deadline into existing program
commitResults.messageBody: Incorporated RecurringDeadline into existing program.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add snooze command functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Added support for snoozing deadlines in Duchess.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: update tests for change in implementation
commitResults.messageBody:
Due to a refactoring of method name, the method Task.toggleIsCompleted() has been changed to Task.completeTask(). As such, all such calls in the test cases have been updated.

TaskTest also had its testing of "un-completing" a task removed, as this functionality is no longer supported.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update javadocs
commitResults.messageBody: Updated JavaDocs for new classes and methods.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: fix bugs with snooze command
commitResults.messageBody: Added additional checks to snooze command.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: change member name to correct casing
tests: update parser test to test new commands
commitResults.messageBody: Updated ParserTest to include a test for the Snooze command.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: add check for duplicate tasks
commitResults.messageBody: Now checks for duplicate tasks (by description) before inserting into the TaskList. As of now, no way around this check.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: extend duplicate check to check task details
commitResults.messageBody: Added functionality to check for task details instead of just description, since it's possible that a user may want to "run" on different days.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build sort command
commitResults.messageBody:
Added sort functionality to the TaskList. The sort follows this order:
- Incomplete deadlines are placed before everything else.
- Within incomplete deadlines, the ones with the closest deadlines are placed first.
- Within the rest of the tasks, incomplete tasks are placed before completed tasks.
- Incomplete tasks are sorted based on original order (stable).
- Complete tasks are sorted based on original order (stable).

The stability will of course change as the user sorts more and more.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build friendlier syntax support
commitResults.messageBody: The commands now support friendlier syntax, allowing users to use short forms of the commands such as "e" for event, "t" for todo, "f" for find etc.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: implement cloneable for task and subclasses
commitResults.messageBody: Updated Task and its subclasses to implement the Cloneable interface and subsequently overwrite the clone() method to produce an immutable clone. This is for state preservation subsequently.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build data structures to support saves
commitResults.messageBody: Added SaveState and SaveStateStack to support the storage of saves. TaskList is also updated to interact with these classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: build undo functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Added support for save states.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: fix bug with platform exit
commitResults.messageBody: Now works for all possible commands that matches BYE.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: update build.gradle to enable assertions when testing
docs+fix: fix up javadocs and bugs
commitResults.messageBody: Should pass all CheckStyle Tests now.

commitResults.messageTitle: feat: update help command
feat: add delete all functionality
commitResults.messageBody: Added functionality to increase ease of deletion of tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: encapsulate save state as a method of stack
commitResults.messageBody: Previously, the same two lines of code were written everywhere. Now it's encapsulated and abstracted out to be a method of the SaveStateStack.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: give appropriate credit for reused work
commitResults.messageBody: Added references to reused work wherever relevant.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: do up documentation for duchess
commitResults.messageBody:
Added Ui image and updated `docs/README.md` with the latest user guide.

To be brushed up later on.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: update shadowjar archive version
fix: fix parsing of deadlines containing slashes
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, if the deadline itself contains slashes e.g. Go for a walk/jog, the command will not be recognised.

Fixed the bug.

commitResults.messageTitle: chore: add mockito to gradle dependencies
commitResults.messageBody: Added Mockito to support more thorough testing.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add tests for save state and attempt to debug deadline test
commitResults.messageBody:
SaveStateTest has been added.

Will be using logging to debug DeadlineTest on Travis.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: fix javadocs for savestatetest
tests: modify test settings to debug deadline test
commitResults.messageBody: Extreme measures to debug deadline tests.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: standardise datetime output casing of datetimestringformatter
commitResults.messageBody: FOUND THE BUG!! The "pm" was being returned as "PM" on Travis. Same for "am". The bugs have been fixed, finally.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update readme
docs: update readme
perf: optimise ui behaviour
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, the logo was a magic string in the printConsoleWelcome method. This has now been raised to a class level constant.

Extra unnecessary lines were also removed, and printConsoleWelcome now actually prints to the console directly.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: abstract max save state capacity into a class level constant
commitResults.messageBody: Changed the max size of 10 to be a class level constant.

commitResults.messageTitle: fix: allow storage to create completed recurring deadlines with end time
commitResults.messageBody:
Previously, recurring deadlines could not be initialised as completed from the storage, even if it had a recurring end time and it's been completed before.

This issue has now been fixed.

commitResults.messageTitle: refactor: abstract the replacing into a separate method.
commitResults.messageBody: Previously, the replacement of uppercase AM and PM was done repeatedly. This repeated code is now wrapped in a method and applied appropriately.

commitResults.messageTitle: docs: update duration parser javadocs
tests: add junit test for string cleaner
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the two static methods: cleanString and cleanAndLowerString.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for pair
commitResults.messageBody: Mainly tests the constructor and supporting functionalities e.g. getters.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for frequency
commitResults.messageBody: The test for the Frequency enum is mainly on its integrity.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for frequency parser
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the parsing of the parser, from user input to Frequency enum.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for duration parser
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the two static methods of the DurationParser - parseDuration and parseDurationToString.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for datetime string formatter
commitResults.messageBody:
The test tests the formatter's handling of datetimes:
- Very long ago
- Long ago
- Yesterday
- Today, but overdue
- Today, but not yet due
- Tomorrow
- This week
- In the future
- Far in the future

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for datetime parser
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the parsing and the exception handling of the DateTimeParser static method.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for ui
commitResults.messageBody: Tests almost every single method of the Ui class using mocks.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for recurring deadline
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the inheritance of RecurringDeadline via its two constructors, tests if it's possible to snooze and its overridden snooze method, and tests the overridden toString method.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests(SaveStateTest): update the test to test getters
commitResults.messageBody: Previously it only tested the constructor. Now it tests the getters as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests(DeadlineTest): add test for the snooze method
commitResults.messageBody: Added a test to check if the deadline snoozes accordingly.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for save state stack
commitResults.messageBody: Tests for the popping capabilities as well as its enforcement of the maximum capacity.

commitResults.messageTitle: tests: add junit test for admin command handler
commitResults.messageBody: Tests the three commands of the AdminCommandHandler as well as their exception handling capabilities.

commitResults.messageTitle: style: reorder imports based on tP requirements
commitResults.messageBody: Previously the import order was the default IntelliJ order. Now, it's sorted as stated on the website [here](https://nus-cs2103-ay1920s2.github.io/addressbook-level3/SettingUp.html#configuring-the-coding-style)

commitResults.messageBody: Slight refactoring of project files, with all parsers shifted into the io folder.
